content.description: Starts by stepping up through big ledges and then moves onto the slab for a couple of bolts before finishing in a chimney.
content.protection: Bolts to a two-bolt anchor. A bit of a strange anchor on this one - uses one wave bolt glue-in with nothing on it, and one hanger with a quicklink and some chain. You could also walk-off, but its a 10 minute walk to get back to the crag.
content.location: Bolt line on an outcropping feature just to the right of the overhang section. Easily identified by its finish

content.description: Wander up two bolts of easier slab climbing to gain a huge ledge which you can lie down on. From here, tackle four, tightly-spaced bolts of super steep climbing. Most of the holds here are quite good, but there are a few cruxy moves which require using something that isn't a bucket. This section of the roof lends quite well to heel-hooking, and it generally contains some of the most gym-like climbing you can experience in Donner.
content.protection: 6 bolts total to lower-off anchors, with the top 4 bolts in the overhang fixed.
content.location: Left of the two lines in the middle of the crag that start on the slab section and tackle the overhang.

content.description: Cruiser climbing past the first three bolts, to jugs out a steep bulge.
content.location: Left side of a bulging wall with two routes on the far right (one with 2 fixed cable draws).
